qas.question: On what grounds did Apple sue Microsoft and Hewlett-Packard in 1988?
How was the lawsuit decided for Apple vs. Microsoft and Hewlett-Packard?
What did the FSF feel that Apple was trying to monopolize on?
How long did the FSF boycott GNU software for the Macintosh platform?
What are some of the issues Apple cited in the lawsuit against Microsoft and HP?

answers.text: the use of rectangular, overlapping, and resizable windows

qas.question: On what grounds did Apple sue Microsoft and Hewlett-Packard in 1998?
How was the lawsuit decided for Apple vs. Compaq and Hewlett-Packard?
What did the FSF feel that Microsoft was trying to monopolize on?
How long did the FSF boycott GUN software for the Macintosh platform?

plausible_answers.text: the use of rectangular, overlapping, and resizable windows

qas.question: What aren't some of the issues Apple cited in the lawsuit against Microsoft and HP?

context: In 1988, Apple sued Microsoft and Hewlett-Packard on the grounds that <a0_0><b5_0>they infringed Apple's copyrighted GUI<b5_0/><a0_0/>, citing (among other things) <a4_0><b9_0>the use of rectangular, overlapping, and resizable windows<b9_0/><a4_0/>. After four years, the case was decided <a1_0><b6_0>against Apple<b6_0/><a1_0/>, as were later appeals. Apple's actions were criticized by some in the software community, including the Free Software Foundation (FSF), who felt Apple was trying to monopolize on <a2_0><b7_0>GUIs in general<b7_0/><a2_0/>, and boycotted GNU software for the Macintosh platform for <a3_0><b8_0>seven years<b8_0/><a3_0/>.
